p: From 1935–1964 to 1982–2011, winter temperatures increased by 0.6°C to 2.4°C from eastern UZ to eastern KG, whereas the highest increase in summer temperatures of 1.1°C was recorded in central and eastern KG ( Fig 3A and 3B). Winter rainfall increased by 56 mm in eastern UZ but remained more or less constant in central and eastern KG ( Fig 3C). The smallest changes in rainfall were observed during summer in the eastern parts of both countries, increasing by 12 mm in northeastern UZ (Chimgan) and southern KG (Karakuldja) ( Fig 3D).
